sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The noble order, or The honour which God conferr's on them that honour His. Humbly presented to the Lords of Parliament, in a sermon preached before their Honours at the Abby Church at Westminster, January 28. 1645. The solemne day of their publick humiliation. / By Daniel Evance Master of Arts Sid. Suff. Coll. Camb. lesse than the least of them all that serve in the gospell. Clement Danes London. Evance, Daniel.
[8], 46, [2] p.
Printed by T.W. for Abel Roper, at the signe of the Sunne in Fleet-street, over against St. Dunstans church, London, : 1646.
Order to print on recto of first leaf. The final leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The noble order, or The honour which God conferr's on them that honour His. Humbly presented to the Lords of Parliament, in a sermon preached before their Honours at the Abby Church at Westminster, January 28. 1645. The solemne day of their publick humiliation. / By Daniel Evance Master of Arts Sid. Suff. Coll. Camb. lesse than the least of them all that serve in the gospell. Clement Danes London. Evance, Daniel.
[8], 46, [2] p.
Printed by T.W. for Abel Roper, at the signe of the Sunne in Fleet-street, over against St. Dunstans church, London, : 1646.
Order to print on recto of first leaf. The final leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Abel Roper
T.W.
the signe of the Sunne in Fleet-street, over against St. Dunstans church
